block.p: Alexandra Lynn Geis and Benim Foster were married yesterday at the Wee Burn Country Club in Darien, Conn. Judge Kevin M. O'Grady of State Probate Court in Westport, Conn., officiated.

The couple, who are actors, perform in a two-person show, ''Last Train to Nibroc,'' which was at the Douglas Fairbanks Theater in New York last fall and more recently at the Piccolo Spoleto Festival in Charleston, S.C.
Alexandra Lynn Geis and Benim Foster were married yesterday at the Wee Burn Country Club in Darien, Conn. Judge Kevin M. O'Grady of State Probate Court in Westport, Conn., officiated.

The couple, who are actors, perform in a two-person show, ''Last Train to Nibroc,'' which was at the Douglas Fairbanks Theater in New York last fall and more recently at the Piccolo Spoleto Festival in Charleston, S.C.

Ms. Geis, who is keeping her name, graduated from Yale. She is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David R. Geis of Barrington Hills, Ill. Her father is the president of Delta Associates, an investment management firm in Barrington, Ill. She is a descendant of Benjamin Harrison.

Mr. Foster, who changed his name, is a son of Arlene E. Stein of Plantation, Fla., and the late Herbert Stein. He graduated from the North Carolina School of the Arts. His mother teaches art at Riverland Elementary School in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. His father was a tax manager for Office Depot in Delray Beach, Fla.
